doc.title: Bull/Bear: American Eagle Outfitters (AEO.N)
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/Citi/American Eagle Outfitters AEO.N 2Q Preview Uncertainty High Tariffs a Burden. Can Sweeney Save the Day 2Q Preview Uncert_2025-08-29

processing_metadata.publication: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/Citi
processing_metadata.input_relative_path: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/Citi

passages.text: We expect a modest 2Q beat vs cons (AMC 9/3) driven by stronger AE sales. We believe AEO took the pain to get clean on inventory this qtr, driving weak 2Q results, but positioning AEO for better 2H. Uncertainty is high for 2H comps given the Sydney Sweeney social media noise. Our web traffic data show a spike in Ecom traffic 3QTD. But whether the attention drives sustainable improved AE comps remains unclear. While AE is getting most attention, aerie remains a weak spot, and the path back to positive comps is less clear. We expect mgmt to guide 3Q sales -LSD (in-line w/cons) but speak to incremental GM pressure this year from higher tariffs. We lower our F25/F26E reflecting higher tariffs and note our F26E of \(\)0.79\(is below cons\)\\(1.15\) as we embed wraparound tariff pressure. With uncertainty high, we see balanced risk/reward into 2Q EPS.

**Sets & TP:** We are raising our 2Q26E from \(\)0.20\(to\)\\(0.22\) based on slightly stronger AEO comps of -2% (vs cons -3%). We are lowering our F25/26E from \(\)0.79/0.85\(to\)\\(0.72/0.79\) (vs cons \(\)0.82/1.15\() driven by lower GM due to higher tariffs. We are maintaining our\)\\(11\) TP, which implies an F26E EV/EBITDA multiple of 4.6x.

**Guidance:** We expect mgmt to guide 3Q sales -LSD (vs cons -2%), GM -200bps (vs cons -150bps) driven by higher tariffs/occ deleverage and SG&A flat to up modestly, implying EPS of -\(\)0.40\( (vs cons\)\\(0.41\)). We expect mgmt to speak to incremental tariff pressure for 4Q GM. We model 4Q GM -290bps (vs cons -150bps).

**Positioning/sentiment:** Short interest is 16% of float, up from 9% three-months ago (see Figure 8). Our conversations with investors suggest investor sentiment is very negative (consistent with our Quant crowding data in Figure 4 and 5, but uncertainty is very high given the noise and magnitude of the attention around the Sydney Sweeney ad campaign (and now Travis Kelce). We believe investors view AEO as poorly positioned to absorb higher tariffs and are skeptical of AEO's ability to rely on price as a tool to offset margin pressure. Third party data (as well as our traffic data) indicates improved trends 3QTD vs 2Q.

Price (28 Aug 25 16:00)US$13.17Target priceUS$11.00Expected share price return-16.5%Expected dividend yield0.0%Expected total return-16.5%Market CapUS$2,282M
(RIC: AEO.N, BB: AEO US)

Citi Research is a division of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the "Firm"), which does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the Firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. Certain products (not inconsistent with the author's published research) are available only on Citi's portals.

Citi credit card data: According to Citi's credit card data, Teen & Children Apparel spend was unchanged in 2Q vs 1Q at \(- 6\%\) . (see Figure 1). (Please see "Card Insights General Description & Disclaimer and Methodology" above the Bull/Bear chart.)
Web traffic: Similarweb data points to a slight improvement in AEO's web traffic from \(- 3\%\) in 1Q25 to \(- 1\%\) in 2Q25. 3QTD trends are \(+23\%\) (see Figure 3).

Citi's Quant Team crowding analysis: According to Citi's Quant crowding data, AEO's long crowding score dropped from \(16\%\) ahead of 1Q EPS to \(9\%\) ahead of 2Q EPS (see Figure 4). AEO's short crowding score rose remained elevated at \(96\%\) ahead of 1Q/2Q EPS (see Figure 5). AEO's net crowding score (long crowding minus short crowding) sits at \(- 87\%\) (on a scale of \(- 100\%\) to \(100\%\) with \(100\%\) being the most crowded net long) vs \(- 80\%\) ahead of 1Q and \(- 46\%\) ahead of 4Q EPS.

(1) Incremental tariff pressure: On their 1Q25 call, management said their F25 mitigated tariff burden was \(\)30-40\(M, with most of the pressure expected to fall in 2H. This equates to\)\sim\$60-80M mitigated tariff burden on an annualized basis. Under previous tariffs, we calculate AEO's tariff rate was \(12\%\) . With most of AEO's key sourcing countries (Vietnam, Indonesia, Cambodia) moving to \(-20\%\) as of Aug 1, we calculate AEO's new tariff rate is \(-21\%\) . Under the new rates, we calculate AEO's new mitigated annualized tariff burden could be \(-\) 120-140M, an incremental \(\)60M\(vs prior.

Given lead times, we assume AEO will largely realize these higher tariff rates beginning in late 3Q/early 4Q, implying they will see an incremental \(-\) 18M unmitigated headwind this year (on top of what they already guided to). This equates to an incremental \(- 40\) bps headwind to F25 GM. We estimate the wraparound impact of higher tariffs that AEO will feel in F26 is \(-\) 75M, or a \(- 140\) bps headwind to GM.
We model F25 GM of \(34.9\%\) (- 440bps y/y vs cons - 380bps) and F26 GM of \(35.2\%\) (vs cons \(36.8\%\) )

(2) What to make of the Sydney Sweeney: While our web traffic points to a spike in AEO's web traffic 3QTD, consistent with the launch of the Sydney Sweeney and campaign on July 23rd, the extent to which the attention translates into positive comp sustainability is unclear. Either way, our view is that the AE brand is positioned much better from an inventory/fashion and marketing perspective this fall vs this past spring when they had too much inventory and the wrong product. Denim is performing well this fall (even TGT and WMT calling out strong denim trends on their 2Q calls) and AE is positioned well to benefit during BTS. We model 3Q AE comps flat (vs cons -1% and our 2QE of -2%).

We note that in hindsight, it makes more sense now that we've seen the Sydney Sweeney and campaign that on their 1Q call, mgmt raised SG&A dollar growth guidance from - LSD to flat, likely to incorporate higher marketing spend around this.
(3) Aerie comp visibility low: Aerie felt more of the inventory/markdown pressures vs AE this spring, and aerie comp trends decelerated

invested in fleece inventory at higher price points, which did not resonate with the customer. Additionally, intimates and swim remain weak categories for the brand. And the overall lounge/athletic apparel market has not been a great category, as customers shift wallet spend back to fashion categories. All of this makes it difficult to see the path back to positive comps at Aerie near-term. We model 3Q aerie comps of -2% (vs cons -1.5%).

Card Insights represent a selected subset of Citi's credit card transactions and are not representative of Citi's overall credit cardholder population. The data is highly aggregated, anonymized and should be considered in the context of other economic indicators and publicly available information. All cards included within Card Insights comprise a panel of more than 10 million US cardholders.

Card Insights consists of selected data from a subset of Citi's credit card transactions and is not representative of Citi's overall credit cardholder population. The data is highly aggregated and anonymized and has undergone rigorous security protocols to keep all customer information confidential and secure. All Card Insights datasets reflect a degree of selection bias whereby general and proprietary methods are used to aggregate and classify transactions into spending categories. Card Insights data is unadjusted for the number of credit card customers and can be influenced by market share gains/losses from Citi's card business. Card- not present transactions are those where the card information was not transmitted directly from the card at the time of transaction and is utilized as a proxy for online, telephone, or mail- order spending. This data should not be considered as indicative or predictive of the past or future financial performance of Citi or its credit card business. F26E comps +3% F26E EBIT margin 5.4% F26E EPS \(\) 1.23\(, P/E multiple 14x\)

AEO is a mall- based teen retailer that operates more than \(\sim 1,200\) stores, primarily in North America, and ecommerce websites. Its American Eagle Outfitters brand, which has \(\sim 850\) stores, sells denim, pants, shorts, sweaters, fleece, outerwear, graphic tees, footwear, and accessories targeted at 15- 25 year old men and women. Its aerie brand, which has \(\sim 500\) stores, sells intimates, swim and loungewear for women.

We rate shares of American Eagle Outfitters Neutral (2). AEO is a leader in the teen retail space. We believe AE comps have softened, while aerie comps are likely to grow +LSD in F25E. On the margin front, we see higher promos, FX, tariffs and fixed cost deleverage to be pressure points. Much of the cost savings announced in AEO's profit improvement plan are getting reinvested into the business (mainly through incentive comp) and it is tough to see how much savings could be realized longer- term in SG&A. Valuation is largely reflecting negative comps and margin pressure, making the risk/reward balanced, in our view.

Our DCF- based target price of \(\) 11\(is based on a 15% discount rate and a 3.0x terminal multiple. Our target price represents an implied\) \mathsf{F26}\mathsf{EV} / \mathsf{EBITDA} \(multiple of 4.6x\)

Risks to our target price include: (1) comps deteriorate relative to our estimates; (2) competitive promotional pressures cause AEO to increase promotions resulting in margin pressure; (3) AEO does not successfully identify and respond to new and changing fashion trends, which would result in lower sales and margin relative to our estimate; (4) cotton or other input costs rise significantly; and (5) mall traffic decelerates more significantly resulting in more store closings than we currently anticipate.

If the impact on the company from any of these factors proves to be greater than we anticipate, the stock will likely have difficulty achieving our target price. However, should they be less than anticipated, the stock could trade above our target price.

**Guide to Citi Research Fundamental Research Investment Ratings:**

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks.Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

**Investment Ratings:** Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of 15% or more or 25% or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "—" and "-" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re-establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short-term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management.Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds \(15\%\) against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
